title: Ami Ayalon, former head of Shin Bet: 'If we refuse peace, what awaits us will be even more violent than October 7'
summary: The former head of Israel's domestic intelligence service fears that the war in Gaza is unwinnable and warns against the eruption of a new Intifada in the West Bank.

title: European leaders attempt to defuse farmers' anger
summary: With less than six months to go before the European elections, the far right is speaking out on behalf of farmers, who are denouncing the harmful effects of the European Green Deal.

title: Economist Hélène Périvier: To boost fertility, 'we need to take advantage of several public policies'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the expert in social and family policy evaluation says that the parental leave policy announced by Emmanuel Macron on January 16 is insufficient by itself to boost France's birth rate.

title: Russia: War opponents may have their property and valuables confiscated
summary: A bill passed by the Russian State Duma on Wednesday enables the Kremlin to maintain pressure on the hundreds of thousands of Russians living abroad in exile.

title: French farmers' protests: Map of the main roadblocks
summary: The mobilization against rising costs and excessive regulations started in Southwestern France and is gradually spreading to other regions.

title: AFCON 2024: Morocco's win over Zambia allows host Ivory Coast to scrape into last 16
summary: The Democratic Republic of Congo drew with Tanzania to secure a last-16 game against Egypt, while Tunisia was ousted from the Cup of Nations after a draw with South Africa. Both Mali and Namibia advanced to the knockout stage after a 0-0 draw.

title: Oscars 2024: Sweeping success of 'Anatomy of a Fall' confirmed by five nominations
summary: Justine Triet's film will compete in the Best Picture category on March 10 in Los Angeles. With 13 nominations, 'Oppenheimer' is the big winner of this year's shortlist.

title: Argentina: Tens of thousands take to the streets to protest Milei's far-right reforms
summary: President Javier Milei has proposed a set of sweeping reforms that lessened some worker protections, abolished a price ceiling on rent and lifted price controls on certain consumer goods, among other things.

title: From the 'Los Angeles Times' to 'Sports Illustrated,' American media is in dire straits
summary: A number of historic American publications are under severe economic strain and have announced major redundancy plans.

title: War in Gaza: Bombs rain down on Khan Yunis where hospitals are under siege
summary: The Israeli army has launched a vast offensive against this town in the South of the Gaza Strip, which it has accused of harboring Hamas command centers.

title: Posy Simmonds wins Grand Prix at Angoulême Comics Festival
summary: The author of graphic novels 'Gemma Bovery' and 'Tamara Drewe' is the first British winner of the top prize at this festival, whose 51st edition runs from January 25 to 28.

title: French journalist in India threatened with deportation right before Macron's visit
summary: Vanessa Dougnac, a correspondent for the French newspaper 'La Croix,' who has lived in India for 23 years, has been in the sights of Narendra Modi's government for over a year.

title: Russia says military plane crashed in Belgorod, killing 65 Ukrainian POWs
summary: Russia's Defense Ministry accused Ukraine of shooting down the plane, killing all 74 passengers aboard, including 65 Ukrainian prisoners of war.

title: French government reportedly blocks book by former ambassador to Niger
summary: According to reports, the French foreign ministry wrote a letter to Sylvain Itté saying that his book 'appears to present more risks than advantages' and it would not be able to authorize its publication.

title: France's Assemblée Nationale examines bill to enshrine access to abortion in Constitution
summary: There is still no guarantee that the fight to protect abortion in the Constitution will be won, given the resistance to this change on the right of the political spectrum.

title: First white rhino IVF pregnancy could save species from extinction
summary: The first successful embryo transfer in a southern white rhino paves the way for using technique to save its endangered northern cousins.

title: Russian lawmakers adopt resolution slamming French 'mercenaries' in Ukraine
summary: Paris has said that it has no mercenaries in Ukraine and that the Russian claims are part of a disinformation campaign.

title: US announces star-studded 2024 Olympic basketball team pool
summary: USA Basketball announced a 41-strong player pool for the 2024 Paris Olympics basketball roster on Tuesday, featuring stars LeBron James, Stephen Curry and Joel Embiid, in a bid for a fifth consecutive gold medal.

title: Palworld: The achievements and controversies of 'Pokémon with guns'
summary: Six million sales in four days: The 'Palworld' video game is making a splash on the Steam platform. The enthusiasm is matched by questions about suspected plagiarism of the Pokémon license and the hazy profile of the development studio's head.
